title: Stabilize math-driven UI, restore launch hero assets, and unify sky-blue accent palette

requirements.summary: Replace remaining green-themed brand accents with a consistent celestial sky-blue accent across the UI while keeping red accents unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: A search through the frontend codebase shows no remaining brand/decoration Tailwind green accent usage (e.g., text-green-*, border-green-*, from-green-*, via-green-*, to-green-*, shadow/rgba green glows) in the launch/hero/theme UI; where a green is used for semantic status, it is either replaced with sky-blue or explicitly justified as semantic and visually aligned with the new palette.
Global CSS utilities that currently create green neon/glow effects (e.g., .neon-text-green) are updated to a sky-blue equivalent and all consumers are updated accordingly.
Components that currently render green gradients for positive indicators (e.g., progress bars) are updated to use sky-blue so the app has a single consistent accent color family (sky-blue + red).

file_operations.description: Update global theme variables and glow utilities to align with the celestial sky-blue accent (while preserving red accents), including replacing the green neon/glow utility with a sky-blue equivalent and updating any related rgba green glow definitions.
Replace positive-state green gradient/progress styling (including any green glow/box-shadow usage) with sky-blue equivalents while keeping negative-state red styling unchanged.

Replace green accent usage used for bullish/positive visuals (bars, RSI low/positive styling, buy signals) with sky-blue equivalents, ensuring the overall chart module uses only the sky-blue + red accent families.
Replace remaining green accent usage (icons/highlights for positive metrics) with sky-blue accents while preserving red accents and maintaining legible contrast.

requirements.summary: Fix calculation and rendering edge cases so countdown, charts, projections, and derived metrics never produce NaN/Infinity or unstable UI states.
acceptanceCriteria: Launch countdown never shows negative values and reliably switches to a clear post-launch state (e.g., “NOW LIVE”) when the launch time is reached.

Charting UI never renders NaN/Infinity-based styles (e.g., bar heights) even when the price range is 0 or when there is insufficient data; it must display a safe fallback UI state instead of breaking layout.
RSI and signal generation never crashes due to missing/short datasets; when not enough candles exist, RSI is shown as a safe neutral value and signals list behaves predictably.
All derived strings (projection text, error messages, labels) are stable (no undefined, no broken formatting) under slow networks and API failures.

file_operations.description: Harden countdown calculations to clamp all displayed time units to safe non-negative integers and ensure the launched state is triggered reliably at/after launch time without any negative display flicker.

Add guards for insufficient/empty datasets and zero price ranges so bar heights, RSI polyline points, projections, and signals never compute NaN/Infinity; render a safe fallback UI when data is missing/invalid instead of producing broken layout.

Normalize and validate parsed market numbers (price/klines) to ensure non-finite values are rejected/handled, and ensure error paths consistently produce stable failures the UI can display safely under network/API issues.

requirements.summary: Fix missing/static-asset regressions so the launch hero background texture and code-horse image load reliably from frontend static assets.
acceptanceCriteria: The launch hero background texture image loads successfully (no 404) and displays with the intended opacity over the black background.
The code-horse image loads successfully (no 404) and displays with the intended glow/drop-shadow effects.
No runtime console errors related to missing `/assets/generated/*` launch images during normal navigation and hard refresh.

file_operations.description: Add the required generated launch background texture asset at the exact static path so it is available via frontend public assets.
Add the required generated code-horse hero asset at the exact static path so it is available via frontend public assets.

Verify the hero references the generated static assets only (background + code-horse) and adjust any path/attribute usage to prevent production 404s on navigation and hard refresh while preserving the intended opacity and glow effects.

requirements.summary: Ensure all user-facing strings changed by these fixes are English and align with the existing translation approach, without touching immutable paths.
acceptanceCriteria: Any newly introduced/modified UI text as part of these fixes is English-first and does not introduce new Spanish-only hardcoded strings.
No changes are made to immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Existing translation keys continue to work and the app builds successfully.

file_operations.description: Add/adjust translation keys needed for any updated UI messaging introduced by the fixes (English-first), keeping existing keys working and avoiding changes to any immutable paths.

Replace any modified/introduced user-facing strings with English copy and/or LanguageContext translation keys; ensure errors, labels, and projection text remain stable and English under loading/failure states.
Update any user-facing strings touched by palette/stability changes to English-first and/or LanguageContext keys while preserving current layout and avoiding immutable path changes.

requirements.summary: Run an end-to-end regression pass and fix remaining runtime, navigation/scroll, and responsive layout issues introduced or uncovered by the above changes.
acceptanceCriteria: No uncaught exceptions in the browser console during a standard run-through: load homepage, interact with launch hero CTA (smooth scroll), open/close chart panel, and view key sections.
Mobile and desktop layouts remain responsive with no overlapping text, clipped CTAs, or unreadable contrast introduced by the palette changes.
`npm` build/lint completes successfully (no TypeScript errors introduced by the fixes).

file_operations.description: Harden section navigation and CTA scroll behavior to avoid broken scroll targets and to respect prefers-reduced-motion (use non-animated scrolling when reduced motion is enabled) while preserving existing navigation structure.
Update the launch hero CTA scroll behavior to respect prefers-reduced-motion and ensure scroll targets remain reliable across mobile/desktop without introducing layout regressions.

Ensure the chart panel open/close flow is robust (no runtime errors on rapid toggles, interval switches, slow networks, or missing data) and that responsive layouts remain readable after palette and calculation hardening.
